Class Buyer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Buyer

  • public class Buyer
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buyer

        public Buyer(int target_size)
        This is a constructor for the buyer class. It instantiates buyer instances with empty logs (TreeMap) and requires a target_size param.
        Parameters:
        target_size - The target number of shares to buy

    • Method Detail

      • getTargetSize

        public int getTargetSize()
        Returns the target_size param
        Returns:
        target_size An integer representing the number of shares to purchase

      • setTargetSize

        public void setTargetSize(int target_size)
        Sets the target_size param. It is not recommended to do this while after adding offers to the log as this could lead to an inconsistent state.
        Parameters:
        target_size - The number of shares to purchase

      • getCostOfTargetShares

        public double getCostOfTargetShares()
        This method calculates the minimum cost to buy target_size shares. Returns infinity if there aren't enough shares available. Potential optimization: + Reduce the size of the tree being traversed by using head method s.t. the highest priced share <= max_price_paid_per_share. This would see greatest benefit when number of offers in the log are much larger than target_size.
        Returns:
        costOfTargetShares The minimum cost to buy target_size shares. Returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there aren't enough shares in the log.

      • addNewOffer

        public java.lang.Double addNewOffer(double price,
                                    int size)
        This method adds a offer to the log and recalculates the minimum buy price for target_size shares.
        Parameters:
        price - The price per share of the offer to be added
        size - The number of shares in the offer
        Returns:
        null if the cost of buying target shares is unchanged Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there are not enough shares to complete the buy new cost of buying target_size shares

      • removeOffer

        public java.lang.Double removeOffer(double price,
                                    int size)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method removes an offer from the log. Then, it recalculates the minimum price to purchase target_size shares.
        Parameters:
        price - The price per share of the offer to remove
        size - The number of shares in the offer
        Returns:
        null if the cost of buying target shares is unchanged Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there are not enough shares to complete the buy
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
